did.unittitle: Jim and Richard Rutter Athletics Interviews
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/spc.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish. Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Jim and Richard Rutter Athletics Interviews (SC1284). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audio interviews with with former Stanford University football players and members of Rose Bowl teams, conducted by by Jim and Richard Rutter. Some interviews conducted upon the induction of the athlete into the Stanford Athletic Hall of Fame.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Rutter (Class of 1954) is an avid Stanford Athletics supporter and enthusiast. His son, Jim Rutter (Class of 1986) serves as official volunteer athletics archivist & sports historian for Stanford University, and is a member of the Stanford Athletic Hall of Fame Committee.

did.unittitle: Dick Horn - Interview at Horn home on 2009-11-02; Sam Morely - Former teammate of Horn with Morely's thought on Horn's induction into the Stanford Athletics Hall of Fame (SAHOF) on 2009-11-06; Bill McColl - Interview at SAHOF on 2009-11-06 & USC game, Kerkorian story, 1951 Big Game
Stanford Football Interviews - Al Rau (1950), 2008-4-10 (Four Varsity FB letters); Marty Anderson (1949) 2008-8-8 (FB letter from Cal and LSJU); Interview by R. Rutter (1954)
Stanford "Steiney" Steinbeck, member of 1928 Rose Bowl team, Stanford Class of 1930 (Cousin of John Steinbeck), Interview by R. Rutter
Stanford Football Interview with Matt Vucinich, member of 1940 Rose Bowl team. Interview by Dick and Jim Rutter
Stanford Sports - Interview with Ed McDowell (1926): Memories of a life-long Stanford fan. Interview by Jim and Dick Rutter
